etymologies: late 19th century (in general sense ‘reverberation of sound’): abbreviation

definitions: an effect whereby a sound, especially that produced by an amplified musical instrument, is made to reverberate slightly

examples.text: the copious reverb on this recording helps to create the feeling of space

shortDefinitions: effect whereby sound is made to reverberate slightly

definitions: a device for producing reverb on an amplified musical instrument

examples.text: there are 16 effects available, including a number of reverbs
